required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 27, 2015
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Point of Care Device Use in the Pediatric Emergency Department
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Trial to Assess the Efficacy of Point-of-Care Testing in Decreasing Length of Stay in a Pediatric Emergency Department

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effect of “point-of-care” (POC) analysis of blood work with traditional laboratory methods on length of stay in a pediatric emergency department (PED).

detailed_description.textblock: This study was a prospective, randomized controlled study of patients requiring blood work that a POC device was capable of performing. Length of time spent at various timepoints were prospectively recorded by a dedicated research assistant after randomization.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

secondary_outcome.measure: Time length for results return, disposition decision, time in ED proper

intervention.intervention_name: Point of Care Device; i-Stat Analyzer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinically requiring bloodwork capable by the POC device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Requiring other bloodwork such as medication levels, WBC
